casebody.data:
McGARRY v. EDISON ELECTRIC ILLUMINATING CO. OF BROOKLYN. (Supreme Court, Appellate Division, Second Department. January 24, 1908.) Appeal from Special, Term. Action by Peter McGarry against the Edison Electric Illuminating Company of Brooklyn. From an adverse judgment and order, plaintiff appeals. Reversed, and new trial granted.

Argued before HIRSCHBERG, P. J., and JENKS, HOOKER, GAYNOR, and RICH, JJ.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment and order reversed, and new trial granted, costs to abide the event, on the authority of Ward v. Edison Electric Illuminating Company (decided herewith) 108 N. Y. Supp. 608.

HIRSCHBERG, P. J., not voting.
